Detailed Description

This is a special class that bridges the gap between CEGUI and HGE.

This class is one of two that must be implemented in order to allow CEGUI to render, the other is the HgeTexture class.

Member Function Documentation

void CEGUI::HgeRenderer::addQuad ( const Rect &  dest_rect,
float  z,
const Texture *  tex,
const Rect &  texture_rect,
const ColourRect &  colours,
QuadSplitMode  mode 
) [virtual]

Used to add a quad to the render queue or render it directly depending on the render queue state.

Parameters:
dest_rect The coordinates the quad is going to be rendered at.
z The Z coordinate the quad is going to be rendered at. I have overriden this so that it always renders at z = 0, on top of everything.
tex The texture UV coordinates of the texture being rendered to use.
tex Pointer to a CEGUI texture being rendered.
colours Vertex colors to use when rendering the quad.

Used to render a quad directly to the screen.

z The Z coordinate the quad is going to be rendered at. I have overriden this so that it always renders at z = 0, on top of everything.
tex The texture UV coordinates of the texture being rendered to use.
tex Pointer to a CEGUI texture being rendered.
colours Vertex colors to use when rendering the quad.

Definition at line 216 of file HgeRenderer.cpp.

virtual void CEGUI::HgeRenderer::setQueueingEnabled ( bool  setting  )  [inline, virtual]

Enable or disable the queueing of quads from this point on.

This only affects queueing. If queueing is turned off, any calls to addQuad will cause the quad to be rendered directly. Note that disabling queueing will not cause currently queued quads to be rendered, nor is the queue cleared - at any time the queue can still be drawn by calling doRender, and the list can be cleared by calling clearRenderList. Re-enabling the queue causes subsequent quads to be added as if queueing had never been disabled.

Parameters:
setting true to enable queueing, or false to disable queueing (see notes above.
